actions.committee: House Committee on Banking and Currency
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Banking and Currency.

official_title: A bill to amend the Urban Mass Transportation Act of 1964 to provide priority in the allocation of funds thereunder to those cities and other public agencies which will permit persons who are at least 65 years of age to use the facilities at specially reduced fares, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Elderly Transit Fare Reduction Act - Provides, under the Urban Mass Transportation Act priority in the allocation of funds to those cities and other public agencies which will permit persons who are at least sixty-five years of age to use the facilities at specially reduced fares during weekdays, weekends and holidays. (Adds 49 U.S.C. 1602(f))

titles.title: A bill to amend the Urban Mass Transportation Act of 1964 to provide priority in the allocation of funds thereunder to those cities and other public agencies which will permit persons who are at least 65 years of age to use the facilities at specially reduced fares, and for other purposes.
